F0BD1DB7F327432CADC86E3E58CA8A9F.description: Differentiate between astrology and astronomy, and explain why astrology is considered unscientific

5B83B4368AE84E3ABB26B4AE01DB3444.description: Identify and describe how people from various cultures, past and present, apply astronomy in daily life

2A9B22D5E6D342DEB7D7F9B5E2B84B01.description: Identify points of reference in the night sky and recognize that the apparent movement of celestial objects is regular, predictable, and related to the Earth’s rotation and revolution

1FAE1E50199F4F75AE57B985806991AE.description: Explain how the relative positions of the Earth, moon, and Sun are responsible for moon phases and eclipses

F67AAB9CB72E4DE29A5DAD919430D5A8.description: Use the design process to construct a prototype that tells the time of day or measures a time span

D7B3E4FC244E4FC0AC66E0B483886902.description: Explain, using models and simulations, how the Earth’s rotation causes the cycle of day and night, and how the Earth’s tilt of axis and revolution cause the yearly cycle of seasons

D8BF421055EB490FA8FE3436915DF9B7.description: Recognize that mass is the amount of matter in an object, that weight is the force of gravity on the mass of an object, and that the force of gravity varies from planet to planet

30322773F9FF4CA69DD3676C3E9F4295.description: Classify planets as inner or outer planets, based on their position relative to the asteroid belt, and describe characteristics of each type

7993766A30584931AF472E57A2318605.description: Identify the planets in the solar system and describe their size relative to the Earth and their position relative to the Sun

7C018AEB83F24574AA74473B180254A9.description: Recognize that the Sun is the centre of the solar system and it is the source of energy for all life on Earth

B1FCFA0482DE4DFB95D5DCF4F4052EDE.description: Describe how the conception of the Earth and its position in space have been continuously questioned and how our understanding has evolved over time

C9AABC31FFE04B418F9D778343B06CCB.description: Identify technological devices placed in space that help humans learn more about the Earth and communicate more efficiently

71937116A4464AF6B52EFF1EF9A3FDE5.description: Describe positive and negative impacts arising from space research programs

31FB6EC0355448AD975B02E465F2B347.description: Investigate past and present space research programs involving astronauts, and explain the contributions to scientific knowledge

EC8484FFA66A4CD0A2B003250CECFB6F.description: Identify Canadians who have contributed to space science or space technology, and describe their achievements

C5752979CD634C598F13F8461F6D88FA.description: Identify technological developments that enable astronauts to meet their basic needs in space

9A84D6A43458433AB91D6A1A42542C5F.description: Use appropriate vocabulary related to their investigations of Earth and space

8CB2509686194A27B81939D347F315AC.description: Describe the ways in which electricity has had an impact on daily life

E9F0AA68D2F04922B9E0B6006EB959C9.description: Describe factors that affect the consumption of electrical energy, and outline an action plan to reduce electrical energy consumption at home, at school, or in the community

6DF567ED27F748E3A0D495AFAF6D4C82.description: Evaluate an electrical device using the design process

79B68099AFDC4001B1BFB164B1841B96.description: Identify renewable and non-renewable sources of electrical energy, and discuss advantages and disadvantages of each

735E65BA3E6744C180C5A0410F99E21B.description: Identify the two major sources of electrical energy, and provide examples of each

FB5E4D0F11BA45348A4536D545F01A38.description: Identify forms of energy that may result from the transformation of electrical energy, and recognize that energy can only be changed from one form into another, not created or destroyed

9D8D28E3D54646F1A5535D5C172157EA.description: Explore motors and generators to determine that electromagnets transform electricity into motion, and motion into electricity

F5E8622C06CC4CED94F473D8918A4F5C.description: Demonstrate, using a simple electromagnet constructed in class, that an electric current can create a magnetic field

5A5516BA3DEA40BE87E05D448BFA095A.description: Use the design process to construct an electrical circuit that performs a useful function

FB81522F72624FE0B0A4405FF95F1B17.description: Explore to determine factors that affect bulb brightness in simple series and parallel circuits.

0D93C898340C4313B3D2173344D264A9.description: Construct and diagram simple series circuits and simple parallel circuits

7491E2563F8A4EFCB62FA9CD47E43510.description: Demonstrate and describe the function of switches in electrical circuits

CC08956B407F418A8580318853C7009B.description: Experiment to classify a variety of materials as insulators or conductors

F0A2725914E94D06AEEFAFE8654051BF.description: Develop a definition of an electrical circuit, based on classroom explorations

0A5A62266F4B416EA041C20F3148842F.description: List electrical devices used at home, at school, and in the community, and identify the human needs that they fulfill

0EEDE3CFD80A4E5B88F1C20B53D82045.description: Identify dangers associated with static and current electricity, and demonstrate and describe appropriate safety precautions

FC3F20A49E694489ACF7BFF13E423061.description: Explain current electricity, and compare the characteristics of current and static electricity by using a model

DA270A6ED7EC4D479DB367EB08F55FCE.description: Explain the attraction and repulsion of electrostatically charged materials

37CE22CDB5E44246AC507E70E60FB15C.description: Use appropriate vocabulary related to their investigations of electricity

E412848A091343EBBB93AACF515D4D29.description: Use the design process to construct a prototype that can fly and meet specific performance criteria

1C58D04BA73B4823B4AFA18C439CBB6D.description: Identify milestones in the history of air travel and describe their impacts on daily life

59770398B5B345BEBFBCAB2896F1B9D8.description: Explain why the design of aircraft and spacecraft differs

D9A1EA4139FF4E318FB5827719F85250.description: Describe how unbalanced forces are used to steer aircraft and spacecraft

2BED6D44D1D0413C8A0245092E67537B.description: Compare a variety of propulsion methods that are used to produce thrust in animals and flying devices

8FCEECB4D2814C5FAEA136D17F86BD2A.description: Identify and diagram the four forces that act on living things or devices that fly through the air

F5E3FE7F585141C89B69246CABDA5134.description: Provide examples of design features or adaptations that enhance or reduce drag, and explain how they work

37859D5D71F840C99B086F1AE6F75DB4.description: Provide examples of design features or adaptations that enhance or reduce lift, and explain how they work

2DF0FB1DB74E42B583863018EAAB475D.description: Explain how Bernoulli’s Principle is applied in a device other than an aircraft

31B9C13878E04D21884D55D5A549A0A1.description: Test models of aircraft to observe Bernoulli’s Principle

61C6400260F24153BF445FCD74A51D9E.description: Describe how “lighter-than-air flying devices” are able to achieve lift

17FD34EC27C54DBB904E121A2ED8572E.description: Recognize that in order for devices or living things to fly they must have sufficient lift to overcome the downward force of gravity, and that the force of gravity increases as mass increases

49791715000A4C30B5B89DE2ED3798D7.description: Identify adaptations that enable living things to propel themselves through air, water, or to be transported by the wind

27E7AC6320F84AE98B26CC63E3CCF368.description: Describe properties of fluids using air and water as examples, and identify manifestations of these properties in daily life

25785B1D52EF42D18F3ADF435F19D47F.description: Use appropriate vocabulary related to their investigations of fligh

96D0FAC2553F438EBE313A472C1818D7.description: Identify and describe contributions of scientists and naturalists who have increased our understanding of the diversity of living things

793EA0BE46854AE7B52089DC87D04959.description: Identify, based on evidence gathered by paleontologists, similarities and differences in animals living today and those that lived in the past

CBBA81C25831488098A47604AC3353B1.description: Compare and contrast the adaptations of closely related vertebrates living in different habitats, and suggest reasons that explain these adaptations

EFA48EA2F21C43839DA49D15BEE93321.description: Classify vertebrates as fishes, amphibians, reptiles, birds, and mammals, and provide examples to illustrate the diversity within each group

D8FEDD50DE5B4B0DABA57BCABD4D0CB9.description: Compare and contrast adaptations of common arthropods, and describe how these adaptations enable them to live in particular habitats

156A2F30B533440AAEE981D4E3B03260.description: Provide examples of a variety of invertebrates to illustrate their diversity

5A5EAA45FEAF49AC9CBCFBA4C8416308.description: Recognize that the animal kingdom is divided into two groups, vertebrates and invertebrates, and differentiate between the two

4972F207BB634D708EE6D359D00F9962.description: Observe and describe the diversity of living things within the local environment

32D05F7CA46D4D4DBAD79E0BE1D649FE.description: Recognize that many living things are difficult to see with the unaided eye, and observe and describe some examples

5D9FE77AF4104AF7B3F0ED687309444F.description: Identify the five kingdoms commonly used for the classification of living things, and provide examples of organisms from each to illustrate the diversity of living things

6699D9E3F085477D907B95BD574A929C.description: Identify advantages and disadvantages of having a common classification system for living things, and recognize that the system changes as new evidence comes to light

48F332A73F394C778D3CEA74BE58A246.description: Identify living things using an existing classification key, and explain the rationale used

E06BCF494DA048378E23E3748E6CD04B.description: Develop a system to classify common objects or living things into groups and subgroups, and explain the reasoning used in the system’s development

1557EFB8EF6143B796B86448FA7F306D.description: Describe various kinds of classification systems used in everyday life, and identify related advantages and disadvantages

B553968E5F4A4CE8B89D9796E44A9962.description: Use appropriate vocabulary related to their investigations of the diversity of living things. Include: classification system, classification key, paleontologist, terms related to names of kingdoms and types of vertebrates and invertebrates

B69963DCCAE24A5F85E349177AE6058A.description: Frequently and thoughtfully evaluate the potential consequences of their actions.

63C08330AF2E45BEA46783A237687719.description: Be sensitive to and develop a sense of responsibility for the welfare of other humans, other living things, and the environment.

FA2484CD82154DEFBDC9025EED02DB87.description: Appreciate the importance of creativity, accuracy, honesty, and perseverance as scientific and technological habits of mind.

7BF12B73FA89433A9954F034D45BFD81.description: Demonstrate confidence in their ability to carry out investigations.

6091BF5D8E76491DBB644E5021904165.description: Show interest in the activities of individuals working in scientific and technological fields.

61B69297F0CA4763946C2441F8EB77DF.description: Appreciate that women and men of diverse cultural backgrounds can contribute equally to science.

72C6BEE9B1514FD4B52AF52D48004264.description: Describe positive and negative effects of scientific and technological endeavours.

7B2BA7E74E224F5DA9A36DD24A61C77B.description: Recognize that science is organized into specialized disciplines.

89F307F110074816B4CDFC96B6AD72CB.description: Describe hobbies and careers related to science and technology.

5944E44E3E68485D8C9D2FA37C89DEE4.description: Provide examples of technologies from the past and describe how they have evolved over time.

2F124AEEDC8542BBB5DDFE75D3E6AF8B.description: Recognize that technology is a way of solving problems in response to human needs.

94FEE505AA194B1E984800738AF1BF31.description: Identify examples of scientific knowledge that have developed as a result of the gradual accumulation of evidence.

5F20070C359A4DF082E23B8C731CC572.description: Recognize that science is a way of answering questions about the world, and that there are questions that science cannot answer.

65E5398E249A4C16B6B71995B34C7FEF.description: Identify potential applications of investigation results

6B20ACE6DE5F4C7299A19F987C6BD95F.description: Communicate methods, results, conclusions, and new knowledge in a variety of ways.

FFE68B9D89274FD0BE0D0F0932C47C77.description: Reflect on prior knowledge and experiences to construct new understanding, and apply this new knowledge in other contexts.

F764C1627B5946239B07B5B4DB389DFF.description: Identify new practical problems to solve.

A64A5247B37E426DAB3E68E56B4ABA57.description: Propose and justify a solution to the initial problem.

CDB83AA0527841FCB0CA8C4623570141.description: Identify a new prediction/hypothesis based on investigation results.

6E725A5B7CBF4F93B4B4BC81638BDF2A.description: Base conclusions on evidence rather than preconceived ideas or hunches.

B8B2D30B3DA64F4896BD90DA70BA69BF.description: Draw a conclusion that explains investigation results.

4C69FD8691A049689B0ADEC400E3A59D.description: Evaluate the methods used to answer a question or solve a problem.

732BD4F92E77463694B4F5342001EA3D.description: Evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of a consumer product, based on predetermined criteria.

37395A582B7540369DC4ABFA041D175D.description: Identify and make improvements to a prototype, and explain the rationale for the changes.

24E5F9710E2E47938E08A79FC7F3FCBF.description: Identify and suggest explanations for patterns and discrepancies in data.

B70FDE4EF7C6420D8135539B33904034.description: Construct graphs to display data, and interpret and evaluate these and other graphs.

3352F3C7D13A44DB8B821AA1F59C4627.description: Record and organize observations in a variety of ways.

249A065EC3514DA19CB146FCAFCCACAA.description: Estimate and measure accurately using SI and other standard units.

56BF23CD18AD4CDF998FD93E90C065F4.description: Evaluate the appropriateness of units and measuring tools in practical contexts.

FD823A986336453383B79BFF7D62A233.description: Select and use tools and instruments to observe, measure, and construct.

8DB1EBCB5B66406AACB657E4595B34CA.description: Test a prototype or consumer product, using predetermined criteria.

70B3880CF63146C79EF4FEAB61246B31.description: Make observations that are relevant to a specific question.

31D3259D56344C2DAEB9E3B066EBE891.description: Use tools and materials in a manner that ensures personal safety and the safety of others

4AEB4633ED334F9B84F043A2038090CF.description: Assume various roles to achieve group goals.

71F8F04080EF4D9D9C5820877A17FFD7.description: Work cooperatively with group members to carry out a plan, and troubleshoot problems as they arise.

09FECE40FB804EAA88D09DA93B1E9971.description: Carry out procedures that comprise a fair test.

8E08523C7B634C44AADEBABD8138A2E2.description: Create a written plan to solve a problem.

8F5074F89DDD44AB9D10C4586363A7FE.description: Develop criteria to evaluate a prototype or consumer product.

073923B8C9E648D9BCFEAA660C4594CB.description: Create a written plan to answer a specific question.

2E7CFEB4F5614585A31B7BF7414DE7F9.description: Identify variables that might have an impact on their experiments, and variables to hold constant to ensure a fair test.

CB3F234B182E4568A50EA95A2322316E.description: Formulate a prediction/hypothesis that identifies a cause and effect relationship.

35B913F9FCB945379E61134E73C0F18A.description: Make notes on a topic, combining information from more than one source and referencing sources appropriately

9F9F628171914EA5B37C6B9DF3F11CF9.description: Review information to determine its usefulness, using predetermined criteria.

62F2BEC0C4AB48B4AF87A9188558F843.description: Access information using a variety of sources.

88EC714E310A41A5828FD101424746F2.description: Identify various methods to solve a practical problem, and select and justify one to implement.

68910920BC694105975E0B0574F47F77.description: Identify various methods for finding the answer to a specific question and select one to implement.

054D83D0825347B58592D476F57A9CC2.description: Formulate specific questions that lead to investigations.
